body_html:
Finally got around to this.
It turns out that that the problem is caused by a workaround in the GPU crosstool wrapper that's used to support CUDA <= 6.0. Does TensorFlow still support those versions? If not, I could remove it.
I've added some extra code that makes the build work with the workaround.

Both problems from before should be solved now, so we can have another go at the tests :)
body_text:
Finally got around to this.
It turns out that that the problem is caused by a workaround in the GPU crosstool wrapper that's used to support CUDA <= 6.0. Does TensorFlow still support those versions? If not, I could remove it.

body:
Finally got around to this.
It turns out that that the problem is caused by [a workaround in the GPU crosstool wrapper](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/e95f4e760c6b6713b6b686ebeff9a1586a5831dd/third_party/gpus/crosstool/clang/bin/crosstool_wrapper_driver_is_not_gcc#L103) that's used to support CUDA <= 6.0. Does TensorFlow still support those versions? If not, I could remove it.
I've added some extra code that makes the build work with the workaround.

Both problems from before should be solved now, so we can have another go at the tests :)
